intro: Silene adscendens, commonly known as the ascending campion, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It has a slender, erect stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Silene adscendens is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or tundra environments.
